newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss back plan to send observers to Hebron.
newsitem.headline: Swiss back plan to send observers to Hebron.

text.p: Switzerland's cabinet backed a plan on Wednesday to send Swiss observers to Hebron as part of an international team backing the agreement extending Palestinian rule to the West Bank flashpoint.

"The Federal Council favoured a positive response to the joint invitation from the government of Israel and the PLO that was presented to Switzerland on January 8," the foreign ministry said in a statement after the seven-member cabinet met.
Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Italy and Turkey were also asked to join the 180-strong mission of trained observers and administrators seeking to ensure security for Hebron residents.
The mission is supposed to last three months, but can be extended by another three months.
The first organisational meeting was due to be held on Wednesday in Oslo, a ministry statement said.
